Include configured server site urls in the base layout so we can build URLs client-side

Introduce endpoint for config repo webhooks

Path: `/go/api/webhooks/:provider/config_repos/:repoId`

- Responds to both push and pull request events
- Triggers an arbitrary config repo based on an ID parameter
    - Config repos need not correspond with the webhook's originating repo
      as one can store config-as-code definitions in any repostiory
    - Introduce new payload types for pull requests and associated
      children
- Refactor webhook request and payload relationship to facilitate support
  for multiple event types and conditional payload parsing under a single
  endpoint
    - Webhook requests are now payload-independent, and are only
      concerned with webhook auth, event parsing, and event validation
    - Webhook payloads are a separate domain object that are only parsed
      after knowing the event type
    - Tests refactored to DRY via parameterized tests over payload
      classes
Update lombok so it works on the latest IDEA

Introduce webhook URL suggestion helper component

This component generates configrepo webhook URLs for chosen providers.
It is shown on the config repo page for config repos where `autoUpdate`
is set to `false`.

This relies on a base-URL building utility which first consults any
configured site URL or secure site URL, falling back to guessing the
base URL from the `window.location` if neither is configured.

The component also informs the user of the provider-specific events to
configure the webhook.

This also introduces a new click-to-copy component that can be composed
more flexibly in that it does not rely on an input field. It will probably
replace <CopyField/>.
Update lombok so it works on the latest IDEA
